documents.document: While soaking wet, Jason Chaffetz announces to President Trump that angry parents are part of the lamestream media. A White House tourist visits Mar-a-Lago.
Over appetizers, VP Pence reluctantly admits to Rick Perry that the New England Patriots are dangerous. A local TV anchor discovers reddit.
A sneering Wilbur Ross reluctantly admits to President Trump that KGB spies are ruining "The Apprentice." Carl Higbie adopts a black child.
During a photo op, Ted Cruz calmly tells Omarosa Manigault that the New Black Panthers are no threat at all. Tila Tequila commits seppuku.
An intense Ryan Zinke patiently explains to Jeff Sessions that Syrian refugees are patriotic Americans. Carl Higbie quotes Goebbels.
After dinner, Paul LePage overhears someone tell Omarosa Manigault that European immigrants are boycotting Ivanka's products. Trump's bodyguard
In a limousine, Liz Cheney boldly informs Betsy DeVos that college professors are about as dangerous as kittens. Bobby Jindal wears a cowboy hat.
At a playground, Jason Chaffetz tries to persuade Katrina Pierson that the in-laws are on point. A White House tourist wrote this week's episode.
At a restaurant, Jared Kushner reluctantly admits to President Trump that the New Black Panthers are struggling to raise money. The sommelier
While lifting weights, Mitch McConnell fails to convince Katrina Pierson that the New York Mets are fake news. A local TV anchor has a meltdown.
With gritted teeth, Jared Kushner convinces Ben Carson that Nazis are spies. James Caan hacks Trump's Twitter account.
In the season finale, Sam Brownback boldly informs President Trump that environmental activists are dropping big hints. President Bush drains the wrong swamp.
While shaving, Louie Gohmert fails to convince President Trump that Jews are filing another lawsuit. A lovable old man gets voted out.
In the Christmas special, David Shulkin fails to persuade President Trump that Mar-a-Lago members are ruining "The Apprentice." Trump Junior
With gritted teeth, Nikki Haley proclaims to Katrina Pierson that ABC reporters are excessively fastidious. Lou Dobbs feels the urgency.
In a parking garage, Rick Santorum informs President Trump that agnostics are moving in next door. Richard Spencer loses an eye.
During a bender, Ryan Zinke admits to President Trump that oil executives are probably contagious. Dana Perino watches 2 Girls 1 Cup.
At a restaurant, H.R. McMaster calmly tells Rick Perry that the stars of Friends are making America great again. Hulk Hogan checks out Tinder.
After dinner, Peter King convinces President Trump that NSA agents are not real. Pat Buchanan stalks the neighbor.
On a hot mic, John Kasich patiently explains to Katrina Pierson that Amway executives are not that horny. Bill Kristol hides the loot.
After a sleepless night, Lamar Smith fails to convince President Trump that school teachers are useful idiots. A "fixer" tries to make memes.
At a diner, Justin Amash tells Betsy DeVos that socialists are conservative Christians. Erick Erickson herds goats in the garden.
On Tuesday, Rick Santorum reluctantly explains to Betsy DeVos that AARP members are big supporters. Richard Spencer pretends to be an alien.
Steve Scalise mistakenly tells Rick Perry that Lutherans are digging holes in the yard. David Brooks goes into mourning.
Over the holidays, Nikki Haley divulges to Kellyanne Conway that the New York Mets are in the Oval Office. George Will hires an assassin.
As part of a bet, Kevin McCarthy fails to convince Omarosa Manigault that international bankers are capable bureaucrats. Tila Tequila trolls the President on Twitter.
Sighing deeply, Jared Kushner informs Omarosa Manigault that LA Times reporters are astonishingly successful. Dennis Miller gets a swastika tattoo.
At a restaurant, H.R. McMaster persuades Kellyanne Conway that Muslims are drug addicts. A man in a yellow cloak feels the urgency.
On Facebook, Ryan Zinke reluctantly admits to Katrina Pierson that the Bushes are infiltrators. Jon Voight falls down a well.
In Dallas, Jeb Bush reluctantly explains to Omarosa Manigault that Canadians are selling counterfeit red MAGA hats. A man in a yellow cloak
While skinny-dipping, Mike Huckabee reluctantly admits to President Trump that prison guards are clamoring for attention. Adam Sandler pukes in Trump's lap.
Over the holidays, Peter King reluctantly admits to Kellyanne Conway that Congressional pages are actually shapeshifting aliens. The White House chef
Smiling serenely, Paul LePage proclaims to Ben Carson that Trump's sons are potential donors. Michelle Malkin slaughters a lamb on the South Lawn.
On Friday, Liz Cheney rudely informs Betsy DeVos that the minions of Soros are not really important. The White House chef loads a pistol.
After a long meeting, Wilbur Ross tries to convince President Trump that the Obamas are faithful conservatives. Jon Voight publishes a book.
On a hot mic, Marco Rubio explains to President Trump that Zoroastrians are crushed by excessive regulations. Peggy Noonan gets voted out.
During a blackout, Jared Kushner reluctantly admits to Kellyanne Conway that ISIS soldiers are immortal. Lou Dobbs gets a second job.
At a coffee shop, Scott Pruitt fails to convince President Trump that prisoners are crushed by excessive regulations. Peter Thiel kisses up.
During a blackout, Lindsey Graham rudely informs President Trump that several dictators are dropping candy wrappers. George Will is the prime suspect.
During a blackout, Lindsey Graham rudely informs President Trump that several dictators are dropping candy wrappers. George Will is the prime suspect.
In Chicago, Butch Otter fails to persuade President Trump that NSA agents are releasing Trump's tax returns. Tila Tequila runs over a homeless person.
During a prank call, Ryan Zinke tells President Trump that North Koreans are pretty adorable. Bill O'Reilly watches 2 Girls 1 Cup.
At a quinceaÃ±era, Steve Bannon decides not to tell President Trump that paleoconservatives are dangerous. The gardener collapses in tears.
In Los Angeles, Butch Otter decides not to tell Kellyanne Conway that police officers are actually shapeshifting aliens. The gardener quotes Chomsky.
A grim-faced General Mattis insists to President Trump that conspiracy theorists are strapped for cash. Vladimir Putin vacuums all the rugs.
In a roomful of children, Paul Ryan carefully explains to Omarosa Manigault that the Clintons are planning something ominous. Eric Trump hires an assassin.
On a dare, Jeb Bush fails to persuade Betsy DeVos that the New Black Panthers are waiting at Trump Tower. James Caan is caught stealing food.
After too many drinks, Mark Sanford informs President Trump that school teachers are on point. Adam Sandler gets punched at a demonstration.
While on vacation, Pete Sessions reluctantly admits to Kellyanne Conway that the Clintons are potential threats. Pat Buchanan fails the bar again.
On Tuesday, Stephen Miller boldly informs Melania that prisoners are withdrawing support. Scott Baio tries to use street slang.
On Monday, Nikki Haley admits to Kellyanne Conway that Russian officials are heavily armed. Clint Eastwood gets tackled by Secret Service.
In Los Angeles, Elaine Chao informs Betsy DeVos that the kids are jealous of Trump. A local TV anchor quotes Goebbels.
A patient Pete Sessions politely tells President Trump that several dictators are untrustworthy. Corey Lewandowski botches an important interview.
With gritted teeth, General Mattis politely tells Betsy DeVos that Russian businessmen are hilarious. Arnold Schwarzenegger hacks Trump's Twitter account.
A sweaty Carly Fiorina boldly informs Omarosa Manigault that black politicians are not returning phone calls. An ex-girlfriend dresses in drag.
In a lost episode, Rick Scott tries to convince Kellyanne Conway that college professors are not to be trusted. Rush Limbaugh struggles to speak.
A grim-faced Steven Mnuchin overhears someone tell Kellyanne Conway that several dictators are fiercely loyal. Corey Lewandowski quotes Marcuse.
An indifferent Rick Scott calmly tells Omarosa Manigault that Alaskans are selling counterfeit red MAGA hats. Adam Sandler quotes Hobbes.
Late at night, Jared Kushner fails to convince President Trump that the in-laws are true Americans. Kayleigh McEnany creates an international incident.
A bedridden VP Pence divulges to Ben Carson that the McCains are no threat at all. Vladimir Putin tries hot sauce.
In a panic, Jared Kushner fails to convince Ben Carson that ACLU lawyers are privy to many secrets. Michael Savage makes a prophecy.
A terminally ill Elaine Chao patiently explains to President Trump that oil executives are oppressed by excessive regulations. Stacey Dash kisses up.
An indifferent VP Pence overhears someone tell President Trump that Somalian immigrants are demanding refunds. Hulk Hogan slaughters a lamb on the South Lawn.
After a speech, H.R. McMaster insists to Omarosa Manigault that Asian immigrants are double agents. Michael Savage quotes Plato.
At Mar-a-Lago, Pete Sessions informs President Trump that Chicago teens are not very affluent. Ann Coulter tries tai chi.
After too many drinks, Jason Chaffetz insists to Rick Perry that oil executives are spies. James Caan snorts a few lines.
In Dallas, Scott Pruitt rudely informs President Trump that Californians are traitors. Benjamin Netanyahu loads a pistol.
At a restaurant, Reince Preibus fails to convince Melania that New Yorkers are big league. David Brooks wins a beauty pageant.
On Facebook, Rick Snyder convinces Jeff Sessions that socialists are dropping candy wrappers. Erick Erickson learns about memes.
During a prank call, Steven Mnuchin calmly tells Melania that white women are reading Breitbart. An adorable orphan goes into mourning.
During a ritual, Lindsey Graham proclaims to President Trump that transgender people are not to be trusted. A mysterious man learns to fly.
In the West Wing, Lamar Alexander decides not to tell Rick Perry that the Feds are not really worth the time. Adriana Cohen cracks a joke.
On Thanksgiving, Justin Amash mistakenly tells President Trump that white working-class men are too turnt. Ann Coulter has a vision.
A grinning VP Pence accidentally convinces Jeff Sessions that Wall Street bankers are up to no good. The butler quotes Goebbels.
In front of diplomats, Paul LePage admits to Melania that those guys are not really important. Kayleigh McEnany downloads a virus.
In the War Room, Peter King persuades Kellyanne Conway that Baptists are ripe for the plucking. Cthulhu trolls the President on Twitter.
While lifting weights, Jared Kushner reveals to Jeff Sessions that Pussy Riot are potential threats. The White House chef tries MDMA.
In the season finale, Scott Pruitt tries to convince President Trump that Iranian immigrants are oppressed by excessive regulations. A White House tourist
While shaving, Justin Amash admits to President Trump that the voters are ready to negotiate. Dennis Miller has to pay the bill.
Sighing deeply, Sean Spicer tries to persuade President Trump that most voters are coming for dinner. Scott Baio briefly says hello.
The evil twin of Roger Stone fails to convince President Trump that Texans are ruining "The Apprentice." Jeffrey Lord makes a racist joke.
In a roomful of children, Ted Cruz overhears someone tell Kellyanne Conway that the hired help are capable of great things. Ivanka's bodyguard
A paranoid Steven Mnuchin informs President Trump that Russian agents are deserving of human rights. Bobby Jindal eats the whole buffet.
After the two argue, Steven Mnuchin tries to persuade President Trump that the caterers are draining the swamp. Scott Baio hides the loot.
After dinner, Hope Hicks informs Jeff Sessions that oil executives are special guests. Bobby Jindal gets punched at a demonstration.
A time-traveling Rand Paul carefully explains to President Trump that the IT guys are probably contagious. Trump's bodyguard interviews the President.
While wrestling, Ryan Zinke persuades President Trump that Apple and Microsoft are true Americans. Trump's bodyguard falls off a ladder.
After a sleepless night, Hope Hicks calmly tells Betsy DeVos that conspiracy theorists are victims of a misunderstanding. Richard Spencer briefly says hello.
In front of tourists, Hope Hicks politely tells Rick Perry that ISIS soldiers are capable of great things. Adriana Cohen quits drinking.
While sunbathing, Rand Paul admits to President Trump that Nordstroms employees are victims of a misunderstanding. A White House tourist makes a racist joke.
After too many drinks, H.R. McMaster persuades Omarosa Manigault that oil executives are dropping candy wrappers. Eric Trump stalks the neighbor.
On a hot mic, Mike Huckabee tries to persuade Kellyanne Conway that NAACP members are pretty adorable. James Caan finds a wallet.
At Trump Tower, Sam Brownback rudely informs Ben Carson that their Twitter followers are in on the joke. The maid makes a final appearance.
In Dallas, Jason Chaffetz proclaims to President Trump that the Romneys are fake news. Chris Christie learns to cook.
On a conference call, Paul LePage convinces Betsy DeVos that cult leaders are lurking everywhere. Michelle Malkin returns no phone calls.
A terminally ill Lamar Smith patiently explains to Kellyanne Conway that Apple and Microsoft are at Mar-a-Lago. Trump Junior quotes Chomsky.
During their morning jog, Rex Tillerson tries to persuade Ben Carson that Trump's sons are harmless. The maid herds goats in the garden.
As part of a bet, David Shulkin announces to Jeff Sessions that feminist lawyers are advocates for secession. A man in a yellow cloak eats the entire cake.
The evil twin of Rex Tillerson reluctantly admits to President Trump that Russian spies are true Americans. Karl Rove chases pets around.
On the South Lawn, Nikki Haley accidentally convinces President Trump that Tumblr users are advocates for secession. God Almighty barely escapes an angry mob.
